titleInfo.title: Runaway Negroes confined in the Police Jail of the Second District, New Orleans.

mods.abstract: RUNAWAY NEGROES confined in the Police Jail of the Second District, New Orleans-- HENRY, a dark griffe, boy, 5 feet 1/2 inch high, 20 years of age; says he belongs to Mr. Robert Charles, of Montgomery, Ala. TOM, a mulatto man, with a goatee, 6 feet high, the little finger of his left hand rut by a saw; says he belonggs to Mr. Elam Alexander, of Macon Bibb county, Ga. The boy is about 37 years old. HENRY, a dark griffe, 5 feet 1/2 inch high, about 27 years, two front teeth a little brokem; says he belongs to Mr. John Collins, four miles above Red Church. W. H. WATERS, Keeper of Police Jail, Second District. mh18 3t
mods.note: Mr. Robert Charles; Mr. Elam Alexander; Mr. John Collins

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
